about.description: I am a software engineer and an innate entrepreneur with 4 years of experience, mainly specialized in Front-End development using technologies such as TypeScript, JavaScript, React, Node.js, and PostgreSQL, among others. I am passionate about creating, innovating in technology and projects, learning every day, teaching, and challenging myself. I work exclusively on projects that create a positive impact on the world, tirelessly committed to making things happen. My habits, continuous learning, and unwavering discipline make me a high-value professional.

hero.title: Hi, I'm {{name}}
hero.description: I develop nice things on the web, <lineBreak /> projects and impossible things.

workExperience.title: Work Experience
workExperience.headline: What I have done so far

coach.title: Programming Mentor
coach.point1: Founder and leader of my programming and personal development coaching school.
coach.point2: Mentor for developers in training and beginners.
coach.point3: Holistic approach: technical and soft skills.
coach.point4: Promoting best practices in software development.
coach.point5: Experience in breaking down complex concepts to ease learning.
coach.point6: Strengthening leadership and effective communication skills.

growthPartner.title: Founder - CEO
growthPartner.point1: Founder of a marketing and software development agency specialized in e-commerce and info-product creators.
growthPartner.point2: Experience working with 2 Spanish brands and 1 Mexican brand.
growthPartner.point3: Leadership of teams: Sales and prospecting (4 people); Content creation and service delivery (3 people).
growthPartner.point4: Business strategist with experience in breaking down complex concepts, leading operational areas of the agency, and managing commercial strategy, including calls with Founders and CEOs.

devBluemedlar.title: Full Stack Developer
devBluemedlar.point1: Lead developer for Nichefire, a US client, involved in the full development of the application, from back-end to front-end, including UX/UI design.
devBluemedlar.point2: Communication with stakeholders in English through weekly meetings and Slack messages.
devBluemedlar.point3: Developed an App/SaaS for processing large volumes of data and integrating AI to identify global trends and benefit other businesses with the collected data.
devBluemedlar.point4: Tech Stack: Node.js · React.js · TypeScript · Material-UI · PostgresSQL · Auth0 · Redux · React Query · Axios · Express.js · UX/UI

devMeli.title: Software Developer (Front-End)
devMeli.point1: Owner and Developer of the fraud prevention area, specializing in chargebacks, leading initiatives from start to implementation ensuring proper execution and follow-up of each project.
devMeli.point2: Developed the Consumption Identification Portal (PIC), a query tool for credit card charges, which reached 20,000 users in its first month and prevented chargebacks totaling $301,701.16 USD.
devMeli.point3: Implementation of modern technologies like React.js, Node.js, Sass, along with tracking tools (Google Analytics) and monitoring tools (New Relic, Kibana) to ensure platform performance and stability.
devMeli.point4: Focus on Testing, CI/CD, authentication, and adherence to best practices (clean code, code quality) to ensure platform performance, stability, and scalability.
devMeli.point5: Active participation in the fraud prevention team, collaborating with back-end, cross-team, UX, product, and security teams.
devMeli.point6: Responsible for weekly on-call/support/monitoring shifts for all fraud prevention applications, ensuring proper functioning and error prevention. Led migrations of legacy applications to improve performance and stability.

devRevai.title: Full Stack Developer
devRevai.point1: Worked as a Full Stack Developer in cross-functional teams focused on solving critical problems and developing new features.
devRevai.point2: Tech Stack: Node.js, HTML, JavaScript, React.js, CSS, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Express.js, Redux.js, TypeScript, Material-UI, REST APIs to optimize user experience and contribute to project creation from the initial phase to deployment.
devRevai.point3: Collaborated closely with the QA team to identify and fix bugs in the application.
devRevai.point4: This experience allowed me to acquire valuable skills in a startup environment, working both on the front-end and back-end.

projects.title: Projects
projects.headline: My Work
projects.description: Following projects showcases my skills and experience through real-world examples of my work. Each project is briefly described with links to code repositories and live demos in it. It reflects my ability to solve complex problems, work with different technologies, and manage projects effectively.

yc-directory.title: YC Directory
yc-directory.description: A Next.js 15 platform where entrepreneurs can submit their startup ideas for virtual pitch competitions, browse other pitches, and gain exposure through a clean minimalistic design for a smooth user experience.

3d-portfolio.title: 3D Portfolio
3d-portfolio.description: A modern 3D portfolio website with interactive 3D models, creating an immersive user experience. Designed a fully responsive, accessible UI with modular, reusable components for scalability. Optimized asset loading for smooth performance, even with high-resolution 3D elements. This project highlights my ability to combine cutting-edge technologies and deliver visually stunning, high-performance web applications tailored to user needs.

rafael.testimonial: Gonzalo is an exceptional leader and negotiator, with great skill in reaching agreements with both clients and suppliers. I had the opportunity to work with him on lead generation for GAB Ventures Growth, an agency he founded from scratch thanks to his know-how in digital marketing and sales. In addition to his entrepreneurial profile, Gonzalo excels in key areas such as automation, integrations, and systems, which were crucial to the success of his agency. I would recommend collaborating with him to any client, supplier, or stakeholder, as he is a professional who not only plans but executes effectively and consistently, ensuring that things get done.
rafael.name: Rafael Martínez

jordi.testimonial: Gonzalo was an excellent teammate. Together, we developed a Mercado Pago application that allows users to identify a charge through this portal, which reduced the number of chargebacks and minimized customer support inquiries. During development, we divided and coordinated tasks, achieving a high-quality final product. In the production week, we detected very few bugs, none of which were functional or prevented the use of the application. I can highlight his strong commitment to the team, his willingness to help, and his great human qualities.
jordi.name: Jordi Belmonte

matias.testimonial: Gonzalo is a great professional. He was my first colleague in the IT world, and I have an excellent impression of him. Always willing to help and share his knowledge with the team. He is a teammate I would choose to work side by side with again, without a doubt! 🙌
matias.name: Matias Ruiz

alejandro.testimonial: We were group mates and part of the stand-up process during our learning journey at Henry Bootcamp. He is someone who is very helpful and highly predisposed to collaborate on new topics, ideas, and with teammates. Always eager to learn and teach, with excellent communication within our work groups!
alejandro.name: Alejandro Oliva

martin.testimonial: We studied together at Henry, a good teammate, he always tried to make everyone understand the subject and supported those who had a hard time closing an idea, he has a good disposition and is very focused on his goals.
martin.name: Martin Llobell

github-actions.title: Github Actions Course
github-actions.description: GitHub Actions, the continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) platform that lets you automate build, test, and deploy processes so you can focus on developing code.

accesibility-web.title: Web Accessibility Course
accesibility-web.description: Web accessibility ensures that people with disabilities can interact with websites and applications. In this course I learned the principles of accessibility and how to improve projects. I learned the fundamental guidelines for creating inclusive and universal projects with the best practices of accessibility standards such as WCAG, ARIA, WAI, semantic HTML, etc.

css-architecture.title: CSS Architecture Course
css-architecture.description: What is CSS architecture? When is it better to use BEM, OOCSS or Atomic Design? I covered these topics in the course, as well as conventions, best practices and common mistakes for writing quality CSS code with Professor Estefany Aguilar.

algorithmic-complexity-js.title: Algorithmic Complexity with JavaScript
algorithmic-complexity-js.description: Algorithm optimization and evaluation of their computational complexity using JavaScript. The course covered fundamental concepts of algorithm analysis, including the different types of complexity, such as O(1), O(n), O(log n), O(n^2), among others, and their impact on application performance. Throughout the course, participants delved into advanced programming and optimization techniques, learning how to write more efficient code through the correct selection of data structures and algorithms. Participants also acquired skills to compare different solutions to specific problems and select the best option depending on time and space constraints.

software-design-patterns.title: Software Design Patterns
software-design-patterns.description: -Identify design patterns according to their application. -Understand the concepts of reusability and extensibility. -Recognize the importance of software design.

js-engine-v8.title: Javascript Engine (V8) & Browser
js-engine-v8.description: I discovered how the JavaScript engine V8 works and its interaction with the browser. I was able to avoid errors such as Hoisting and fix the code. I learned how the JIT Compiler, Memory heap, Call stack and JavaScript Runtime work.

advanced-react.title: Advanced React
advanced-react.description: I learned how to implement advanced techniques in Render Props, Higher-Order Components (HOCs) and Custom Hooks. Improve application state management using State Machines and Zustand. Also, optimize website performance with Server-Side Rendering (SSR), Lazy Loading and other advanced strategies.
